p:
Territory of Washington County of Spokane }ss In the district court of the Fourth Judicial District of the Territory of Washington holding times as Cheney in the county of Spokane for the counties of Spokane Lincoln and Douglas.
Ther territory of Washington vs. S.P. White } Indictment for murder in second degree S.P. White whose full jurisdiction cause is to the grand jusry unknown in assured by the grand jusry of the Counties of Spokane Lincoln and Douglas in said Territory and the district aforesaid by this indictment of the crime of murder in the second degree committed as follows: The said S.P. White on the Twenty first day of December AD 1884 in the county of Lincoln in the Territory of Washington and the district aforesaid in and upon one Ames Light Beardon feloniously wilfully purposefully and by his malice aforethought did make an assault and that the said S.P. White a contained revolving pistol, then and there charged with gun powder and one leaden bullet, then and there feloniously wilfully purposely and by his malice aforethought did discharge and shot off to against, and upon the said Ames Light Beardon; and that the said S.P. White, with the leaden bullet aforesaid and by this pistol aforesaid then and there by the force of the gun powder aforesaid by the said S.P. White discharged and shot off an aforesaid then ans there feloniously wilfully purposely and of his own malice aforethought did strike penetrate and wound the said Ames Light Beardon in and upon the left side of the body of the said Ames Light Beardon giving to the said Ames Light Beardon then and there with the leaden bullet aforesaid as as afore- said discharged and shot and of the pistol aforesaid by the said S.P. White in and upon the left side of the body of the said Ames Light Beardon one mortal wound of the depth of six inches and of the breadth of one-quarter of an inch of which said mortal wound the said Ames Light Beardon from the said twenty- first day of December A.D. 1884 until this twenty second day of the same month of December A.D. 1884 in the county aforesaid did languish, and lay inching did live on which said twenty-third day of December A.D. 1884 the said Ames Light Beardon at the county aforesaid of the mortal wound aforesaid died. And as the Grand jury aforesaid upon said oath fo say then the said S.P. White the said Ames Light Beardon in the manner and by the means aforesaid feloniously, wilfully, purposely and of his malice aforethought did kill and murder, against the peace and dignity-of the Territory of Washington and contrary to this form of the statute in such case make and provided. Dated at Cheney in the District aforesaid the 17th day of April A.D. 1885 S.C. Hyde Prosecuting Attorney
Names of Witnesses the Grand Jury H.S. Beardon J.L. Beardon Charles Prindle H. Portch A.J. Reeves J Lisle E.A. Portch Mrs. M.A. Lisle Frank Beardon
